polls.question: Which is better, one big ZeroBlog or several small ones? (More in the comments)

comments.body: Other. I am in Eurasia. She isn't in the list.

If the size of the zeroblog began to approach 10MB, is it worth making a clone to continue in a separate blog (leaving a link to it in the old blog) or is it better to continue to update one big zeroblog? I think the first option is better and it answers ZeroNet ideology :)

**Если размер зероблога стал приближаться к 10Мб, стоит ли сделать клон для продолжения в отдельном блоге (оставив на него ссылку в старом блоге) или лучше продолжить пополнять один большой зероблог? Мне кажется, первый вариант лучше и он отвечает идеологии ZeroNet :) **

> @ssdifnskdjfnsdjk
> I think you are not wasting any significant data transfer by updating one large zite

I think more about the fact that users do not have to press the button "SET LIMIT to 20MB" and so on :)

>it is better searchable

If/when a normal search appears, there will be no difference whether it finds data in one blog or not. In the current format of communication, readers still read the blog in order. And if they reach the end, if there is interest, they can always poke the link "Download the previous part of the blog".
Obviously, other things being equal, there will be more votes for the most common language: D
